website_summaries.verdict: A great light-duty tree pruner, but it isn't suitable for use on large trees.
pros: Cut and hold feature holds the stem until you release to prevent branch from falling to the ground
Sturdy metal pole that won't bend
cons: Can only cut branches up to half-an-inch thick

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend This Product
customer_reviews.text: I am an elderly woman with bursitis in both my hips and shoulders. I have had to stop doing yard work and enlist the services of a contractor to do the mowing. There are places that need to be pruned such as around the propane tank so that I can safely navigate with my walker to check the fuel levels. After reading the reviews for this clipper / pruner, I purchased it and today I used it for the first time. It worked wonderfully for me - - both for the smaller overgrowth like vines and the more fibrous type growth. I highly recommend this product for anyone, and especially anyone who has a medical / physical challenge.
customer_reviews.author: countrybelle

customer_reviews.title: Blade snapped in half
customer_reviews.text: Blade is made of potmetal or cast iron not steel, snapped in half pruning blackberry bushes?
customer_reviews.author: Phone tech

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The head piece loosened and broke the first day that I used them on relatively small branches. I ultimately cut my hand on these and required stitches, which I attribute in part to the weakness of the piece, but that was not 100% the fault of the pruners. I would not buy these. I would like to return these for a full refund, but apparently, I missed the window of time. I will attempt to contact the seller and update or remove the post if I am satisfied with the response I receive, if any.
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: Works great on roses and geraniums
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because it hurts my back to bend over and cut the roses and the duranium that are planted in the ground. It is also difficult to reach the high hanging flowers without using a ladder. This product is fantastic. The handle even rotates making it easy to change the direction of the cutting blade. Also the black rubber handle support moves up and down the shaft adjusting to your needs. If you want to cut dead branches this is not the product for you. If you want to trim your flowers this product is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Samole

customer_reviews.title: Works well until it broke
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for a couple of months (of course right until after the return window closed), but using it this weekend the mechanism in the handle broke (made out of plastic) and now it will not work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this...
customer_reviews.text: A long reach pruner that holds onto a branch is such a useful concept. In real life though it takes a good deal more leverage than this device has to cut anything above small, soft branches. I have a grip of death and it still doesn't work. Absolutely useless on my woody roses and so I had to wade in and shed blood as usual. It is useful on pond lilies and recommended for that use. Much easier to clean the dead ones up now.
customer_reviews.author: Carlgo

customer_reviews.title: and it's great to have in your hand strolling through my own ...
customer_reviews.text: Nifty gadget I witnessed being used at the Dallas Arboretum in huge flower beds of tulips to prune, then lift out the spent flowers. I immediately researched and ordered one, and it's great to have in your hand strolling through my own garden. Pruned dead twigs out of the Japanese Maples today.
customer_reviews.author: Target Shopper

customer_reviews.title: it's true!  it can't cut anything other than flowers
customer_reviews.text: fortunately, i can use it for that, to reach flowers without disturbing the bed by walking in it. but if you want something that can cut anything other than flowers--look elsewhere. really. and it's heavy in your hand...so if you're old or have issues with your hand...this is not so great from that standpoint.
customer_reviews.author: marsh

customer_reviews.title: Better than sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: Where has this thing been my whole life? We have a tree rose that flowers like crazy and previous years of dead heading the top areas was always fraught with thorn mayhem. Now I just stand back and pull them off. Perfect. Part of the clipper hold the stem so after you cut it you can bring it down for clean disposal and not have it descent into the bush. Can reach the back branches of the other roses with similar safety. Only complaint and a minimal one at that is the head of the clipper takes a little maneuvering to clip a single blossom from a group. Did I say I love this thing?
customer_reviews.author: R. Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Best tool I’ve bought this year. I buy a lot of tools.
customer_reviews.text: Sort of cheaply made YET the best tool I bought this year. I spent 45 minutes cutting water shoots from my mini-orchard. Last year it took me 3+ hours of dragging an orchard ladder around, leaning over and reaching out. This tool grabs the shoot and you can swing it into a pile for collection later. Also good for thinning thorny citrus trees and avoiding 1.5” thorns. Very pleased with the functionality. Not a substitute for a loper or hand shear. Not for cutting woody branches. But for what it does, couldn't better The light weight is a feature, not a flaw.
customer_reviews.author: DJR

customer_reviews.title: Like a Toy!
customer_reviews.text: This item is being returned. It is utterly impossible to exert the necessary leverage to clip even the smallest branch off of a tree. Even if it did work--which it does not--the pole is not extendable.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Cohen

customer_reviews.title: These are good only for small clipping jobs! Not sharp and offer no leverage.
customer_reviews.text: These clippers were fine to deadhead geranium flowers, roses and yarrow. Try to cut anything with any width or any woodiness and they are so dull they won't make a dent. Then if you try to get some leverage by turning the handle (and therefore the pole and the clippers) the handle turns and you have no leverage that way either. I would not purchase these again. I didn't keep the packaging, or these would be promptly returned. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: K. C. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for one hour until a screw fell out.
customer_reviews.text: The product worked great for the first hour. I noticed it wasn’t cutting as well and investigated the blade area. A screw had fallen out! Would it be possible to get a replacement screw or a new tool to replace the broken one?
customer_reviews.author: thomas cole

customer_reviews.title: Does what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a light duty tool that works well on green stems and vines such as ivy, bougainvillea, and rose bush, but don't expect it to cut actual tree branches anywhere close to 1/2 inch thick. I did not expect that, so I'm not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Grendel

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lightweight tool to take stems w/leaves attached off a medium-sized tree, in my front yard. I'd considered other tools, but they were ungainly or really pricey. Initially, I was skeptical of this tool because of its low price. But wow, am I glad I bought it! Its super-easy to wield & to use, and features a "hold" feature that keeps the cutting in its blades until you can bring it to the ground. The only thing that would make it perfect would be if it was a little longer haha....but otherwise it IS perfect. It even cut very thin, young branches fairly well for me. Worth a buy for me!
customer_reviews.author: Fiat

customer_reviews.title: Cuts and holds onto stem for easy removal.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to trim koi pond lily plants Great feature to cut and remove the dead leaves and expired flower. Cuts the stems and holds on to it. handle rotates so gripper Fingers are located on the Correct side of the cutter blade when making cuts. Would give 5 stars if a bit longer. Great for pond. Sturdy. Been exposed to water many times and Has not rusted. Can’t say I used to trim my bushes but it will cut green stems. Not sturdy enough for thicker branches. Great for what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Ann & Ed Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Useful, with caveat
customer_reviews.text: The product literature at Amazon says that it will cut a 1/2 inch branch. No way. There is no leverage, and the plastic handle would break long before the branch is cut. It is good for cutting much smaller branches, and it will give me about an extra 4 feet of reach. That's handy. Also, I may be able to use this to pull down a larger branch far enough to get a proper cutter on it.
customer_reviews.author: W Thomas

customer_reviews.title: great for trimming climbing rose bushes
customer_reviews.text: I have neck and shoulder issues so reaching above my head is painful. I have tall climbing roses--this tool allows me to dead head the roses and hold on to the cutting and get it directly into a can instead of it falling to the ground. I wish I could adjust the reach of the tool--what you see is it. It cannot cut thick those stems. A watching feature would be a great addition to this tool. Overall, it works for my needs and saves my neck and shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Syd

customer_reviews.title: Best garden tool I have ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim, hoping it might help me with the spiky weeds that have taken over my back canyon slope, and I could not be happier that I did! Its reach and its grab have allowed me to remove weeds I had let go and what's better, to lift them without having to touch them and to drop them into the waiting barrel without even needing to wear gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H

customer_reviews.title: Spend More and get something better
customer_reviews.text: This isn't useless, but at 46" it's barely longer than a standard set of loppers, and it has much less cutting ability than that. The clippers will only get the very smallest of branches without really wrestling with them. Also, the swivel only seems to get in the way for me, it doesn't actually seem useful. I'd recommend getting something with a telescoping pole, and maybe (haven't tried it yet) one of those pruning saws on the end rather than the clippers.
customer_reviews.author: H. L. G.

customer_reviews.title: I like the Idea
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea and makes it easy to do quick pruning above arm's reach. However after a couple of weeks of light use the spring has already gotten weak. This means the blades no longer fully pop back open. I purchased the Corona brand thinking it would be better quality than similar products from other companies. This product needs quality improvements.
customer_reviews.author: DHA

customer_reviews.title: Great for the pond, but yard...not so much...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pruner specifically to trim pond plants. As lily pads fade I use this to snip them off, and the side grab feature is excellent at holding the trimmed pieces for easy removal from the pond. However, I tested this pruner on twig sized branches of trees/brush that I wanted to snip away from our satellite dish, and it totally failed to cut through them. We're talking twigs of no more than 1/4". So, for pond use I give it four stars, and yard use I give it zero stars!
customer_reviews.author: J. DoyleTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Worked just as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Please pay attention to the reviewers who warn this tool is NOT to be used in place of lopers or any heavy duty use. Please do not push the tool beyond it's limits. The device performed as I expected. It is the second one of similar design I have had over thirty years. This tool is great for small twigs, blackberry brambles and branches smaller than 1/4 ". (I do not think it will cut 1/2" without stressing you or it. Forget doing that!) It is a great back saver for me - a certified senior citizen am I.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light trimming.
customer_reviews.text: It says it will cut through branches up to 1/2" but I wouldn't recommend it. Maybe 1/4 to 3/8's. I have a Mimosa tree that is full of seed pods every fall and they wind up everywhere if not snipped off. This tool is perfect for the job. Took a fraction of the time it took in previous years. The ability to hang on to what you have just trimmed and place it in a pile or receptacle makes clean up a breeze. Very sharp but not for heavy pruning. Use it for how it was designed and you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Farkash

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely useful light, long reach,  small diameter pruner.
customer_reviews.text: A very welcome tool for many medium-long-reach, small diameter pruning tasks. We removed the "hold" device (two plastic pieces) because they often block a clear view of pruning sites. The handle rotates slightly (we assume this is intentional); more trouble than help so we disabled this feature. Light weight is a real plus; allows extended use. Accurate one handed operation, however, is limited. The cutting blades more often than not fail to return to full open position. We hope that with more "wear in" time this annoyance will correct itself. On the whole a well made, practical addition to one's arsenal of yard work tools.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Wiliams

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these things. You know the stem on a leaf...it would cut that. Anything thinker was no good, it wouldn't cut it. It's not a very long reach either. I ended up just going to the store and getting the kind that have the rope you pull that are super long and made short work of my tree trimming. These clippers are absolute garbage and don't work.
customer_reviews.author: A Nonymous

customer_reviews.title: a far reaching clipper
customer_reviews.text: The object of the pruner is to reach vegetation without bending over. However, the benefits go beyond that. It also is great for reaching higher and deeper than regular pruners. Ex: Trimming the arbor vines. Because of the pruner's construction, I can reach high trim all the vines without a ladder, and because of the gripper part, I can grab a cut vine and pull it out while standing on the ground. ALSO great for trimming vines that cross the walkway.
customer_reviews.author: Anton Dotschkal

customer_reviews.title: Pruning THORNY Blackberries
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a couple of weeks ... using it to prune blackberries with thorns. The length is about right to reach in and get the sprouts near the ground without having to bend over. The 'hold on to the cut off piece' is a lot more useful than I had thought it would be ... allows me to pile the cutoffs away from the plants. I can work without gloves and not worry about getting thorns. The shaft rotates 180 degrees so that the 'hold on' always has the cutoff. Works faster that a hand pruner with less effort and no thorns in hands, arms ...etc.
customer_reviews.author: Diyguy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Cut 1/2-inch Diameter Branches
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pruner so that I could easily trim items that were either near the ground (so I wouldn't have to bend or kneel) or just beyond an arms reach vertically. While they do aid in reaching things, they do not trim 1/2-inch diameter branches. You cannot exert enough force using the squeeze handle to cut 1/2-in diameter branches.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Meyer

customer_reviews.title: It works fairly well and the "grabbers" work great at holding onto the stems of the cut water ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to prune water lily pads in my small water garden pond. It works fairly well and the "grabbers" work great at holding onto the stems of the cut water lily pads. Occasionally it fails to cut through a rotting lily stem. Instead of cutting, the stem is squeezed between the blades. It seems that this mostly happens when I attempt to cut at a sharp angle instead of perpendicular to the stem. Also the blades being wet, (underwater), and the rotting lily stems being slick due to a slime coating, are likely contributing to this as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Not a heavy duty pruner
customer_reviews.text: It works OK for pruning small branches and trimming suckers coming out low in plants; but anything more that 1/4 inch and slightly dry, forget it! Probably marginally worth the price--it you want to do just touch-up pruning.
customer_reviews.author: Bob911

customer_reviews.title: Helps reach small, awkward branches
customer_reviews.text: Would have appreciated a description of how thick a branch this limb lopper can handle, as it turns out to only handle limbs the size of a thick pencil. It is, however, helpful by allowing me to reach between branches or under bushes without getting scratched, as well as about doubling my overhead reach.
customer_reviews.author: Msmoskowitz

customer_reviews.title: Won't work on most tree branches or much else
customer_reviews.text: Was planning to get on ladder and remove tree limbs rubbing on roof. Unfortunately won't cut anything near as large as a small tree limb. Won't even work on weeds that I normally would pull out but hard to reach into planter to pull. Solved no problems except to make it clear- "buy Fiskars only"! This is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Dann

customer_reviews.title: Great for small branches up high
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy that I got this for those high branches that I was unable to reach and how do use a ladder for in the past. It is difficult to use for thicker branches. It’s not strong enough. If you use it strictly for small branches it is a great tool. However if you need some thing to cut more substantial branches this when I do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: happygolucky4life

customer_reviews.title: Solid tool
customer_reviews.text: The long box it arrives in is deceptively light. The construction of the tool is very solid. The ability to grip what you snip makes this tool very versatile so you can pull back what you have cut to be able to collect it up and discard the clippings. I use it to clip specific unwanted vegetation (long grass clumps, tall weeds, tree starts, etc) from the top of a retaining wall garden while standing below. The grip of the pincer is very strong and only grabs what you have cut. I would recommend this tool to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: best additipn to my gardening tools
customer_reviews.text: as a senior with a bad hip and knee, any yard work I do must be done while seated on my Pride mobility scooter. Your pruner allows me to do on my own, what previously I could only accomplish by paying someone to do. Not only am I saving money, but I get things done exactly as I want. It is so much easier than trying to talk someone else through it.
customer_reviews.author: D Vivian

customer_reviews.title: Nice trimmer. I wish it cut larger branches
customer_reviews.text: Nice trimmer. I wish it cut larger branches, but works as advertised. Don't plan to cut a branch larger than a pencil, the pruner doesn't have the leverage or strength to cut through. I think part of that is caused by the plastic "holders" to grab the cuttings. It looks like those can be removed by screws if you don't need to hold the clippings, then it might cut larger items. For small stuff, like poison ivy vines, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement
customer_reviews.text: Though I wish this tool was about six inches longer, I really like many features. It is very light weigh, yet has a sturdy feel to it. The option of the cut and hold works very well, and is helpful for throwing branches right in the green waste without having to bend over to pick them up. The handles for the cutting action are sturdy and comfortable. A new favorite tool for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use 1/4 inch diameter cuts
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for 1/4 inch diameter cuts and grabs the cuttings for easy disposal. Obviously these have a plastic handle so not for thicker branches. Really saved me from a lot of bending and reaching! I actually trimmed my catsclaw with them when the landscaper said he couldn’t reach :(. Anyway looks fantastic but I did need to get the bigger clippers for the 1 inch diameter cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic Mama

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I found that this pruner was of very limited use. The branches of whatever you are pruning must be fairly soft. You can't get much power from the way the pruner is designed. And you must hold the pruning stick at 90 degrees to the branch you are cutting. It does not swivel. For pruning bushes with soft branches no higher than you can hold the stick level, this might work. But it does not perform well for other plants and trees. Better is to buy the Corona pruner listed for about $45 on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. T.

customer_reviews.title: light weight, easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trimmer specifically for use in removing over stock of Lily pads in my Koi pond. It worked like a charm. Located the stems & pinched them, lifted them out of water, and gone. I dont know how it would work on anything else, but I intend to try it on my Rose bushes, to keep away from the thorns. I like it a lot, and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: joanne

customer_reviews.title: Great reach for small trimming
customer_reviews.text: This pruner is terrific to help deadhead flowers, harvest fruit, or trim branches. However, it will only work on branches about the diameter of a pencil or smaller. That being said, for what I need it for, it works beautifully. This is not meant to take the place of a full sized lopper.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine V.

customer_reviews.title: LIGHTWEIGHT PRUNER FOR OVERHEAD WORK
customer_reviews.text: After struggling overhead with a two handled pruner, I had to find something easier. This Corona is perfect for pruning a tall potato vine. I can't say how well it would work on something woodier or thicker. It worked well on branches just under 1/2". Lightweight and not hard on the hands.
customer_reviews.author: Roxie509

customer_reviews.title: Long reach cut 'n' hold pruner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for gathering wild blackberries. Wild blackberries are full of very sharp thorns. This trimmer allows me to snip the stems loaded with berries... gather the stems in a bin... and remove the berries from the stems using pliars and tweezers... thus avoiding the thorns. I'll probably find other uses for this trimmer as it's well designed and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Coning

customer_reviews.title: The best trimmer I have
customer_reviews.text: Great garden trimmer. When you cut a branch it holds it so you can drop it in the trash without having to pick it up later. It is strong but light weight. We live on a hill. I wish they made one twice as long so I wouldn't have to set up a ladder to reach the really tall shrubs. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Retired G

customer_reviews.title: back saver!
customer_reviews.text: where has this pruner been all my life!? I love it, I go on a daily stroll through my garden with it, and everyday I use it to both cut and remove weeds from my various beds. I love that is holds on to whatever it cuts, so you can move either to my other hand or some other local.
customer_reviews.author: W. Page

customer_reviews.title: This is no more than a twig cutter and not a long-reach pruner at all.
customer_reviews.text: I am more than disappointed. This is no more than a twig cutter. It won't cut anything other than the offshoots of a branch. I also expected it to have a longer reach. It doesn't extend at all. My regular non-long reach pruners can reach as high. Maybe I had done too much research that I got confused over which had the features that I needed in one pruner. I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: susan b.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trimming a unruly Bougainvillea
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for trimming a unruly Bougainvillea. It is planted in a corner and I couldn't reach the top without a ladder. Too old to be climbing on ladders. These did the trick and they are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer 1

customer_reviews.title: A must trimmer for seniors and handicapped
customer_reviews.text: Great cutter, built well and very reliable for seniors who have a hard time bending over to trim or reaching up to trim. Works fantastic to grip and cut small branches. Just point red grip side towards branch to trim and it holds it so you can drop it in your barrel or bucket. I'm very handicapped from 6 back surgeries and it helps me keep all my bushes trimmed and looking good. On the ground trimming of new shoots or suckers is a snap
customer_reviews.author: Jack C

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Just received yesterday 7/16/20. I think I have cut just about every dead leaf, wilted flower and to reach thorn stem rose in my yard. I had also collected dead lily stems and flowers in my Koi pond....no need getting wet. My wife also enjoys this item but I think I hogged it mostly......she will get her turn. Lol. Great invention, we will look to more nifty items for the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Jerblonski

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: This cutter was much too light duty for my application, it didn't suit my purpose. As usual though, Amazon took the unsatisfactory product back with no problems. This product may not have worked up to my expectations, but Amazon is still my favorite place to shop.
customer_reviews.author: redrumpres

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a joke . It doesn’t cut any real branches. At best, it cuts small rose bushes.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool to pick lemons and limes in my trees
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly as it is suppose too. I can pick lemons and limes off my trees w/o a ladder. It hold the fruit by the stem. It does exactly what I bought it for. It is not however a heavy duty pruner for branches and dry dead branches over 1/4" diameter. You have to use the back of the cutter jaw for the thicker stems.
customer_reviews.author: SandClemente

customer_reviews.title: Use for cutting plastic zip ties that are out of reach
customer_reviews.text: It works well for cutting zip ties that are out of reach otherwise. Sometimes I can't get the thick blade close enough and have to use another tool, but most of the time this one works well. I remove a lot of old cabling from buildings and have to cut a lot of zip ties.
customer_reviews.author: Gralfus

customer_reviews.title: Makes The Cut
customer_reviews.text: Great for weeding and trimming in raised beds that you don't want to walk in. Also were great for picking asparagus that I couldn't quite reach. Very sharp, very light weight and very maneuverable because the cutter end will rotate.
customer_reviews.author: Bob P

customer_reviews.title: Shipped broken
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box I couldn’t figure out how to make it work. When I figured out it was broken and there were no pieces in the box I realized it was packed broken. On the good side I did get a full refund
customer_reviews.author: C Becks

customer_reviews.title: Works great for smaller branches
customer_reviews.text: Works great for smaller branches and grass. Can also be used for picking up fallen smaller branches. Seems to be constructed well. I limit use to under about .28 inches thickness (a little over 1/4 inch).
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my greenhouse
customer_reviews.text: I use this to trim unruly vines in my greenhouse which is packed full. Remove dead flowers, leaves etc. It has the perfect reach for my needs. Plus it's lightweight. Corona products are always my go to for gardening tools. Makes my job much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanneweimer

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pruner because I saw the high ratings for it and I needed a pruner that can reach overhead. This one is not it. After a few uses, it no longer cuts, not even vine thin branches. the squeeze mechanism seems to have lost its cutting ability.
customer_reviews.author: apricot

customer_reviews.title: Nobel prize.  I trimmed smaller branches of a lemon tree, cherry tree and Peach tree.
customer_reviews.text: This has already paid for itself many times over with just a few hours of use. If it breaks now , who cares. It saved me several hundred of dollars that a tree cutting service would charge.
customer_reviews.author: ez

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how they can make the claim of a 1/2" cut. It has about the power of a pair of scissors. Anything over 1/8" was a struggle. The thickest twig I could cut was a green one, about 1/4", and that was with a lot of squeezing, twisting, and ripping.
customer_reviews.author: barhd420

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Used to cut dying Lilly pad leaves and other plants from my pond. Works great. Only problem is pond is big and when I have to reach far out, hard to maneuver. Not product fault. Works great on trimming yard and veggie garden too.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: Great for picking fruit. Just clip the branch just above the high dangling fruit and ease it down to the ground - it really holds on to the clipped branch so the fruit doesn't drop. Works so well. Lightweight too. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trimming hard to reach plants/dead water lily blooms in ponds/water features
customer_reviews.text: Love that it holds on to the cutting. It did leave a small oil slick type thing in my pond water which scared me because I have 14 fish that were swimming through it. However, they were fine. I suggest wiping the blades before using in a pond. If I have to grease it some day I might use Vaseline to protect my fish. Works freakin awesome for pond plants, dead water Lilly flowers
customer_reviews.author: W. Billingsley

customer_reviews.title: Great yard tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool if you have trouble bending over. Well made and works on low and high trimming. I love it, has made my yard work much easier. Not too heavy, good for older people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent high quality trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I like how it holds whatever I cut so I can trim branches and limbs and just drop them in the trash can without having to rake the trimmings. The cutting head also rotates so I can easily turn it in the right direction to hold the trimmings. I normally use it to go around my yard to quickly trim off the "wild hair" branches, dead branches, etc. In a short time my yard looks great and I can go much longer without having to do a full trimming with the hedge trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Curt B.

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This product works, but the quality and material used is marginal. I would pay for Fiskar type quality and , at this price or slightly more, it should be easily available.
customer_reviews.author: toomuchtohear

customer_reviews.title: Those Oranges hiding inside my orange tree don't stand a chance!
customer_reviews.text: Slides deep into my orange & grapefruit trees, cuts the fruit free, & holds onto it while I extricate it from the tree. I hope Mr Corona is proud of himself, because he should be. Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lakemechanic

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp enough to cut more than a twig...
customer_reviews.text: I like this tool but it only works for very small diameter branches which are not very high. SO....I let my grandkids use it because I don't think they can do much damage with it. They love to cut things but give up in disgust pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mme CJS

customer_reviews.title: Does not cut growth over 1/4" in diameter.
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of Corona products. I bought this pruner to reach the tops of an 8' acacia shrub privacy hedge. The light weight and maneuverability of the product was great but I could not trim the new growth which was over 1/4" in diameter. This product does not have the cutting power for more. I measured the diameter of the clippings to be accurate here. I had to get a ladder and my standard Corona tree pruner to cut the new growth that was 3/8 - 1/2" in diameter. If 1/4" diameter or less is all you are cutting, this will work great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1/8” max cutting capability
customer_reviews.text: Cut number one- 1/8” rose- success Cut number two- 1/8” tree branch- success Cut three- removed grabbers and made series of small slices to get through 1” green fir branch- success Cut four- tried to cut 1/2” buck brush- handle snapped Good for little flowers not so good for anything else
customer_reviews.author: Roger D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs cutting thin branches from top of Japanese Maple Tree
customer_reviews.text: My 10yr old Japanese maple is now 12ft+ tall and growing. I can't trim the top unless i'm on a step ladder, but with this pruner- I can easily reach the branches.
customer_reviews.author: Philip, San Jose CA

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut the lilies off of my pain so I did not have to get inside of the pond at works well for that. Do not know how it would work cutting limbs because I do not want to dull the blades. So I cannot attest to how sharp it would be cutting limbs.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Howard

customer_reviews.title: Don't need this much, but when we do, I've got it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat little item and works fine for small cutting jobs. It's great for reaching into areas that are hard to get to.....like around a pond. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: raiderred

customer_reviews.title: cuts stems and thin branches - not berry vines
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that it wasn't strong/sharp enough to cut the 3⁄4" berry vines that I couldn't reach. The head size is the same as hand pruners. The grip handle/cutter is a great idea. However, the cutting head is weak and can only cut at one angle in line with the pole.
customer_reviews.author: Bloomingirl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trimming pond lilies
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for trimming pond lilies, just as other reviewers have said. I love that it grasps the clipping and holds onto it so I can easily dispose of it. This is so much easier on my back! My lilies are hard to reach particularly towards the back of the pond because of all the surrounding plants. Thrilled to have discovered this!
customer_reviews.author: TKDMom

customer_reviews.title: Works, but very fatiguing to the hand
customer_reviews.text: This does what it says, as long as you aren't trying to cut anything with much resistance. I used it on Himalayan blackberry wands (more like a raspberry wand, in terms of texture to cut, than a wooden branch or a vibe). It cut and grasped fine. With only a hand-grip's worth of leverage, it takes more squeeze power to fur than you would expect. I thought I could use it to cut off blackberries (where they were coming back up after being mowed) at ground level without stoop labor. I could do that, but my hand was worn out from the squeezing in way less time than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A.

customer_reviews.title: Great value , light, easier on back n arms
customer_reviews.text: I love this, I have rotator cuff problem and many weeds and roses and briars. Worked great, I didn't want to stop. Holder works good too on stickers. I hope it lasts awhile, so worth the money and clip with one hand and support with bad arm. Only cuts a little bigger than 1/4 inch but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Not very sharp
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but not good control working overhead. Keeps twisting around. Okay for clipping small items on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Cold in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: great for small branches
customer_reviews.text: These long reach clippers are perfect for pruning high branches without having to get on a ladder. They are clippers, not lopers, so they are built for small branches. Do not try to cut anything over about 3/8". They are very sharp, and the grip is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: jaybird

customer_reviews.title: Great for clearing out that pesky weed.
customer_reviews.text: This works as described. It allows you to actually get at the offending weed and snip it at ground level. Gives you an extra bit of arsenal as you tackle gardening.
customer_reviews.author: A C

customer_reviews.title: Works fine on small branches and stems
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive, lightweight tool that works fine on slender stems--I used it on my blackberry patch--Note that it willl NOT cut anything thicker than a No. 2 pencil-- I tried it on dead tree branches and it literally couldn't cut it. Fine for smaller stuff, for larger limbs gert a heavier duty cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Chas Fleischman

customer_reviews.title: Light duty only
customer_reviews.text: I removed the branch/twig grabber part and just rake.Works good on smaller scrubs,roses and similar plants,anything other than something fairly soft.I think it would not last very long.
customer_reviews.author: MickE

customer_reviews.title: Great for pruning lillies in a pond...
customer_reviews.text: I had some long handled shears that I was using to prune the lilies that are going crazy in my pond. The problem was, I would cut them and then have to figure out which ones were cut and find the loose leaves to pull them out. It was a real hassle. But this device, that cuts and holds whatever you cut, works beautifully. Much easier and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Gerrits

customer_reviews.title: Cut and hold feature is a nice plus
customer_reviews.text: Great little product. Cuts well. I didn’t realize until after a few times that it will hold the cut piece if you orient the cutter head correctly. Requires a good amount of hand strength just due to the nature of the product.
customer_reviews.author: BCB

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold all cut branches/ very light duty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to harvest elderberries and was disappointed to find that thin branches are not held in place when the cut is made. This was the reason I bought this pruner. The construction feels cheap and it struggled to cut branches of hardwood even a 1/4" to 3/8" thick.
customer_reviews.author: K. Finney

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong, but handy
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't cut green branches much thicker than a pencil, but I like that it holds what you cut until you let go. I will probably not use it much as a pruner, but it will get use snipping weeds out of the middle of my rain garden where it's hard for me to reach.
customer_reviews.author: Jen M

customer_reviews.title: Ability to reach further
customer_reviews.text: I use it for deadheading wildflowers in a garden that's about 20 feet long and 12 feet wide. It was impossible for me to deadhead the flowers in the middle before I had this tool. Now it's easy.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: A most useful tool!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I used this tool right out of the box to clear a dense cluster of lilikoi vines. It works just as described and did not create any fatigue or discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: LizKauai

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pond Plant Pruner!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to reach plants in my pond that needed to be cut back. For this job the Corona Long Reach worked very well! I especially liked the rotating shaft which allows one to cut, grasp, and remove plants to both the left and right side...a very convenient feature. For pond use I would highly recommend this pruner! Pruning tree branches was a different story though. I found it cut through 1/4" twigs very well, but trying to cut anything thicker than that was nearly impossible. I would not recommend this pruner if you need to trim anything thicker than 1/4" from trees or bushes. JJM
customer_reviews.author: JJM

customer_reviews.title: A "MUST-HAVE" FOR CUTTING FLOWERS IN DIFFICULT TO REACH AREAS.
customer_reviews.text: New favorite tool for deadheading or cutting roses without getting tangled in thorny bushes. Also great for reaching tall climbers. One must be strong enough to do this for any length of time, as you do need to use the usual one hand and your arm can get tired. I will never be without this, as I very much love cutting flowers of all kinds and this allows me to avoid compacting soil as well, by not having to venture into flower beds as deeply. So far, it is very sharp, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Geoffrey

customer_reviews.title: She's got a bad back and can't bend over to groom her rose ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my sister. She's got a bad back and can't bend over to groom her rose bushes like she used to. This long handled pruner fits the bill perfectly, and we were so pleased to discover that the cutting end can be rotated to approach from just about any angle. Corona has been the family brand for pruners and loppers ~ this is another great tool to add to your arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: kreativ1

customer_reviews.title: as expected
customer_reviews.text: nice price, great idea. But,,,, its much too light and the swivel is quite irritating. A better made version with no swivel would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Teachman

customer_reviews.title: Cuts thin branches like butter.
customer_reviews.text: This is really an awesome product. For thin branches it cuts like butter! I’m 62 with arthritis and this is just a perfect tool!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my water lily pond
customer_reviews.text: A great addition to my lily pond. Before I purchased this, I was trying to clip off spent water lily leaves with a long handled clipper. Invariably I'd clip a new stem that I hadn't meant to cut. With this cut & hold clipper, I've rarely made a mistake in cutting something unintentionally. I still can't understand how it cuts and grabs the stem for removal from the pond, but however it does it, it works.
customer_reviews.author: Joyous

customer_reviews.title: High quality pruner
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast and the tool is high quality. It is very sharp and does the job well. My wife loves it and so do I. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: GoneFishin

customer_reviews.title: Surprising
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical and I understand this won’t last forever. But it definitely makes life easier. Awkward angles at time and you need both hands to get thru bigger stuff. But it is worth the price
customer_reviews.author: bradley smith

customer_reviews.title: there has to be a better way, a way to hold it as you ...
customer_reviews.text: Cutting my wife's roses for her I was thinking, there has to be a better way, a way to hold it as you cut it. And here it is. Easy to use, lightweight and durable. This made cutting the dozen rose bushes a lot easier and less painful. Pros: Lightweight Twistable to get the right angle Just the right reach. Cons: The grip doesn't stay (fixed with some electrical tape to thicken up the shaft) On some of the thicker branches, it really feels like im going to break the grip or the mechanism between the grip and the cutter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ivey

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great!!!! The blade is sharp and the 'hold' part firmly grasps the part to be removed. Its a life saver for someone who has difficulty bending to pick up plant parts that have fallen to the ground. Just be careful to not cut the stems you want left on the plant. The 'hold' part can sometimes obstruct your vision.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Fears

customer_reviews.title: Nice reach and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for small to medium jobs which is what I bought it for. And it does that great. Easy to handle and operate.
customer_reviews.author: stephen j devincenzo

product_meta.title: Corona LR 3460 Long Reach Cut 'n' Hold Pruner, 46-Inch, Red
product_meta.description:
Color:RedDesigned for professionals and passionate gardeners looking for heavy-duty durability and lasting performace, season after season. Maximum sharpenss, durability, and strength. Higher quailty materials offer strenth and performace.

AMAZON.COM
Founded in the early 1920s, Corona is a leader in the marketing and manufacturing of professional and consumer tools for the lawn and garden, landscape, irrigation, construction and agriculture markets. With a retail and distribution network that extends throughout the United States and Canada, Corona’s proven designs, quality manufacturing processes and unparalleled customer service make it the best choice in tools for contractors, agricultural professionals and avid gardeners alike. Limited lifetime warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Founded in the early 1920s, Corona is a leader in the marketing and manufacturing of professional and consumer tools for the lawn and garden, landscape, irrigation, construction and agriculture markets. With a retail and distribution network that extends throughout the United States and Canada, Corona’s proven designs, quality manufacturing processes and unparalleled customer service make it the best choice in tools for contractors, agricultural professionals and avid gardeners alike. Limited lifetime warranty.

See more
feature_bullets: REACH HIGHER WITH AN OVERALL LENGTH OF 46": Allows reach to otherwise inaccessible areas.
CUT 'N HOLD FEATURE HOLDS STEM UNTIL YOU RELEASE: Assists in preventing falling limbs and allows you to cut safely.
ERGONOMIC CO-MOLDED HANDLES FOR COMFORT: Designed for extended use. Adjustable foam grip provides balance and easy of use.
CUTS UP TO 1/2 INCH DIAMETER: Blade is PTFE non-stick coated for easier cutting.
HIGH-CARBON STEEL BLADE AND HOOK ARE FULLY HEAT TREATED FOR DURABILTY: Extends life of the tool season after season.
Cut and hold feature holds stem until you release

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,102 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
